label: 道慈
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Monk of the Sanron school who traveled to China from 701 to 718, receiving in-depth instruction in Mādhyamika from 吉蔵 Chi-tsang and, presumably, was taught the esoteric rite 求聞持法 gumonjihō by the Chen-yen (J. Shingon) monk Śubhakarasiṃha (善無畏 Zenmui). After his return, he taught Sanron at Daianji, and was famous as a lecturer on the Chin-kuang ming tsui-sheng-wang ching scripture at the imperial court.
